items.title: Bondi heroes to be recognised in new honours list, PM says
items.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says those who showed "extraordinary" bravery during the Bondi terror attack will be recognised in a new honours list, similar to those used after the Bali bombings and the MH17 plane crash.

items.title: Gunmen's phone pinged near region known for Islamic extremism, police say
items.description: Mobile phone data suggests the Bondi Beach gunmen may have travelled near a region in the Philippines where Islamic State-aligned militants could still be operating, a police source has told the ABC.

items.title: British man's visa cancelled after being charged with displaying Nazi symbols
items.description: The Australian government has promised changes to make it easier to deport people who spread hateful views.

items.title: Epstein files email show 'A' at 'Balmoral' sought 'inappropriate friends'
items.description: Someone who referred to themselves as "A" at "Balmoral" emailed convicted child sex offender Ghislaine Maxwell in 2001, asking if she had found them "some new inappropriate friends", the latest Epstein files document dump has revealed.

items.title: 'Fake' note about Trump in Epstein files, Justice Department says
items.description: The US government says newly released documents from the Epstein files contain "untrue and sensationalist" claims about Donald Trump.

items.title: Woman survives 500-metre crawl with broken ankle in remote Arnhem Land
items.description: With no mobile phone coverage and no chance of anyone hearing her call out, Margie Moroney decided to crawl back to the campsite she was sharing with her colleagues.

items.title: Islamic school faces de-registration over comments about Zionism
items.description: A NSW Islamic school could face de-registration if it does not provide evidence its principal is "fit and proper".

items.title: Trump wants the US to lead on 6G. Here's when Australia could get it
items.description: Donald Trump says he wants the United States to lead the world in the "6G race" and has given his government one year to find out how to begin making it happen.

items.title: Girl, 12, in critical condition after being caught in rip at Perth beach
items.description: A 12-year-old girl is in a critical condition after a surfer pulled her unresponsive from the water at Trigg Beach on Tuesday.

items.title: English cricket investigating Duckett social media video
items.description: A video said to feature Ben Duckett is under ECB investigation in another problem for England's disastrous Ashes tour.

items.title: Tropical Cyclone Grant nears islands as Christmas heatwave scorches WA
items.description: Preparations are underway far off Western Australia's north-west coast for the impact of a category one cyclone as much of the state continues to swelter in heatwave conditions.

items.title: US student to spend Christmas with Perth man after saving his life
items.description: Battling acute myeloid leukaemia, Gennaro Rapinese finally found a suitable bone marrow donor on the other side of the world in the US. And, after making a full recovery, he got to thank her in person in the lead-up to Christmas.

items.title: Tropical Santa goes high-tech to beat the summer heat
items.description: Santa Claus has devised a special ice esky throne to beat the heat in outback Australia this year.

items.title: Russell Brand charged with another two sex offences including rape
items.description: The British comedian now faces seven charges of sexual assault involving six separate women.

items.title: Christmas festivities return to Bethlehem after two years
items.description: For the first time in two years, Bethlehem has restarted its Christmas festivities to "reignite the spirit that everybody needs" while Palestinians continue to live under restrictions.

items.title: Kate Winslet's son wrote a screenplay — and he asked his mum to direct it
items.description: Dame Helen Mirren has a rule that she will never play someone with dementia or dying of cancer. She broke that rule for Kate Winslet, after reading the script for Goodbye June.

items.title: ABC radio host Sabra Lane farewells AM after nine years
items.description: Sabra Lane is farewelling the ABC's AM after nine years of hosting the current affairs radio program.

items.title: Sydney to Hobart set for strong starting winds, but nothing like 2024
items.description: The Sydney to Hobart fleet is in for milder conditions this year than in 2024, when two people died on the first night of racing, although sailors have been warned to expect strong winds.

items.title: Woman accused of 'repeatedly encouraging' partner to suicide granted bail
items.description: An Adelaide woman accused of repeatedly encouraging her partner to take his own life has been granted home detention bail.

items.title: Live: Aussie dollar jumps to 14-month high, ASX falls as gold and silver hit record highs
items.description: The Australian share market is down on Christmas Eve, despite the value of US stocks, gold and silver climbing to their most expensive levels ever, while the Australian dollar has jumped to its highest level since October 2024. Follow live.

items.title: Young motorcyclist issues warning after life-changing crash
items.description: Liam Ganter does not remember the crash that nearly killed him, but he is living with the consequences, and hopes his story will stop others making the same mistake.

items.title: Man charged over alleged antisemitic social media comments
items.description: A WA man's eligibility to hold a gun license will be reviewed after police charged him with allegedly posting antisemitic comments on social media.

items.title: Man dies after e-scooter accident in Geraldton
items.description: Police say a man has died after losing control of an e-scooter in Geraldton overnight.

items.title: Half-dozen illicit tobacco operators rack up multi-million-dollar unpaid fines
items.description: Illicit tobacco retailers have racked up millions in unpaid fines since the introduction of stronger penalties, with one owing more than $7 million.

items.title: '$10,000 worth of Louis Vuitton' stolen in alleged home invasion
items.description: Two armed offenders allegedly forced the occupant of a house north of Hobart to open a safe, escaping with about $10,000 worth of Louis Vuitton items, police say.
